alert.note: Alert for Grant; Huntington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:10AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following counties, Grant and Huntington. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended across the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen sine last evening. Runoff from this heavy rainfall may lead to some standing water on roadways early this morning. - Little or no additional rainfall is expected through daybreak. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion, Huntington, Gas City, Fairmount, Jonesboro, Sweetser, Swayzee, Van Buren, Sims, Converse, Lancaster, Mount Etna, Hanfield, Landess, Home Corner, Lake Wood, Banquo, Jalapa, Roseburg and Pleasant Plain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
